citeinfo.origin: Fisheries and Oceans Canada - Ocean Science And Productivity, Pacific
citeinfo.title: Physical, Chemical and Biological Oceanography of the Haida Eddy, 1999-2000

descript.abstract: A study of the physical, biological, and chemical oceanographic characteristics of eddies originating off the Queen Charlotte Islands heading out to the deep ocean. Feb, June, Sept 2000 (main study of Haida 2000).
descript.purpose: Observing the biological, chemical, and physical oceanography of an eddy event off the coast of British Columbia.
descript.supplinf: Priority: 4 Priority Justification: Null Risk Justification: Data not secured in regional data centre. Data in various formats and not well backed up (ie, multiple media stored in separate locations) Risk of Loss: Medium Impact Justification: Data are related to a subject, location or species of concern within the scientific, government or public community within the last 5 years. Impact of Loss: Medium Recommended Action: Bring rest of data to archives when available. Additional Info: Part of Line P cruises.

idinfo.useconst: May be subject to proprietary period restrictions to access

cntaddr.address: Institute of Ocean Sciences, P.O. Box 6000, 9860 West Saanich Road

dataqual.logic: Standard IOS procedures for processing CTD data and chemical parameters.
dataqual.complete: Dataset Complications: Much of these data are in progress. Electronic Data Complications: Some data have yet to migrate to OSAP archives.

procstep.procdesc: Some data collected collaboratively with UBC (phytoplankton and primary productivity.)

cntaddr.address: Institute of Ocean Sciences, P.O. Box 6000, 9860 West Saanich Road

stdorder.nondig: Hardcopy Original Exists: Y Hardcopy Locations: Joseph Linguanti Rm 1246 IOS Hardcopy Description: Various log books, data sheets, cruise reports Hardcopy Volume: Several hundred (entire archive) Hardcopy Complications: Null Physical Sample Exists: Y Physical Sample Locations: Dave Mackas Physical Sample Description: zooplankton and neuston samples fixed in formalin Physical Sample Complications: Should be kept in a well-ventilated room.
stdorder.ordering: Contact data custodian once data have reached the archive. Before that, contact the researchers.
